meanings.definition: A person who has power or authority over others.
meanings.sent1: The lordoma of the castle made important decisions.
meanings.sent2: The king was the lordoma of the entire kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The lordoma of the playground decided the game rules.
meanings.sent4: She was the lordoma of the household, guiding everyone with wisdom.
meanings.sent5: The lordoma of the forest animals protected them from harm.

meanings.definition: To rule or govern as a lord.
meanings.sent1: He sought to lordoma over the land and its people.
meanings.sent2: The knight was determined to lordoma his own destiny.
meanings.sent3: She tried to lordoma the situation, but things quickly got out of hand.
meanings.sent4: The CEO liked to lordoma the company with a firm hand.
meanings.sent5: The magician could lordoma the elements with a wave of his hand.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being a lord.
meanings.sent1: The lordoma of the manor was one of luxury and privilege.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, the lordoma was a position of great responsibility.
meanings.sent3: The lordoma of the party was evident in the extravagant decorations.
meanings.sent4: She lived in the lordoma of wealth and opulence.
meanings.sent5: The lordoma of the land was a title passed down through generations.
